books.title: Tarzan, Lord of the Jungle
books.author: Edgar Rice Burroughs
books.summary: Journeys, times, and cultures collide as two expeditions seek the riches of known and fabeled lands.

books.title: The Story of the Treasure Seekers
books.author: E. Nesbit
books.summary: Six siblings search for treasure in order to restore their lost family fortune.

books.title: You Can’t Win
books.author: Jack Black
books.summary: Jack Black’s autobiographical account of life “on the road” as a professional thief and hobo during the late 19th century and early 20th century.

books.title: Personal Recollections of Joan of Arc
books.author: Mark Twain
books.summary: A fictional biography of Joan of Arc from her early teenage years to her martyrdom.

books.title: The Magic City
books.author: E. Nesbit
books.summary: A young boy, upset by his older sister’s recent marriage, builds an imaginary city out of blocks and household items and then finds himself living inside it.

books.title: Arms and the Man
books.author: George Bernard Shaw
books.summary: A humorous examination of human hypocrisy and war’s stupidity in the midst of the Serbo-Bulgarian war.

books.title: Cymbeline
books.author: William Shakespeare
books.summary: A British princess marries a poor gentleman against her father the King’s wishes.

books.title: The King of Elfland’s Daughter
books.author: Lord Dunsany
books.summary: The people of Erl want magic, and get their wish.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: Kate Chopin
books.summary: A collection of Kate Chopin’s short stories, ordered by date of writing.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: Arthur Machen
books.summary: A collection of nine short fiction works by influential supernatural and horror author Arthur Machen.

books.title: Seven Pillars of Wisdom
books.author: T. E. Lawrence
books.summary: T. E. Lawrence’s memoir of leading the Arab revolt against the Ottoman empire during World War I.

books.title: The Powerhouse
books.author: John Buchan
books.summary: A secret criminal organization is uncovered after an M.P.’s friend goes missing.

books.title: What’s Wrong with the World
books.author: G. K. Chesterton
books.summary: Philosopher G. K. Chesterton comments on various social issues of his day, including property, imperialism, feminism, and education.

books.title: An Enquiry Concerning Human Understanding
books.author: David Hume
books.summary: Hume examines the fundamental nature of knowledge, reality and human understanding.

books.title: Poetry
books.author: Edgar Allan Poe
books.summary: A collection of Edgar Allan Poe’s poetry.

books.title: The Little Nugget
books.author: P. G. Wodehouse
books.summary: The ambitious fiancée of an English gentleman asks him to kidnap the son of an American businessman from boarding school, before professional kidnappers get to him first.

books.title: Star Hunter
books.author: Andre Norton
books.summary: On the unexplored jungle world of Jumala the sole survivor of a spaceship crash is heir to a fortune, or has been made to believe so.

books.title: Fables
books.author: Aesop
books.summary: Aesop’s classic Fables of behavior and consequence.

books.title: The Divine Comedy
books.author: Dante Alighieri
books.summary: Dante journeys through Hell, Purgatory, and Heaven in order to receive salvation and to find divine love.

books.title: Recollections of Full Years
books.author: Helen Herron Taft
books.summary: Helen Herron Taft, wife of William Howard Taft, the twenty-seventh President of the United States, recalls her life married to one of America’s most influential political figures.
